reviews.text: Quite small and simple but good size stage and sounds. Blue lights are really bad, as you can see, it's hard to take pictures. So sound is nice, but visuals not so much.

Nice place! I have spent a good time here at the concert. There was a separate section for  underaged people near the stage, so they could feel comfy.
At the main zone there is a bar with good beer and polite staff. Note, that the cloakroom service is not free. The fee is about 3‚Ç¨. You can pay by card here.

Good little bit of the country‚Äôs history, ruined by abysmal staff attitude.

I visited during the Ratikamuseo exhibition, which featured a charming display of 6-8 old trams along with vintage clothing and equipment used by tram staff from that era. The exhibition was informative and well-presented.

However, my experience was marred by an encounter with an older gentleman who informed me that dogs were not allowed in the museum. As a responsible dog owner and trainer, my two medium-sized dogs were leashed and well-behaved by my side. I requested to see a sign indicating this policy, as such notices are typically displayed at entrances.

The gentleman responded rudely, insisting, "It's on the internet, and anyway, you should know." I pointed out that there was no URL or signage at the entrance indicating their policy. Despite my polite attempt to discuss the matter, he insisted I leave immediately.

I left written feedback suggesting they clearly display a sign about their no-dog policy at the entrance to avoid future misunderstandings.

In summary, while the exhibition itself was enjoyable and well-organized, the experience was significantly detracted by the rude and unwelcoming attitude of the staff member, which dampened the overall atmosphere.
Unbelievable good place for mingling and refreshing. This time with vendor but beer tasted the same in the end :)
I went to see a rock concert and the place is perfect for that.  Old trams create an atmosphere.  Good acoustics. ü§òüèª
